message_1:
Suppose you have a data set with observations on six variables. You want to examine the underlying structure of the data to determine which variables are related to one another. If you perform a factor analysis and obtain five factors with the following variance explained for each one:

Factor 1: 30%
Factor 2: 25%
Factor 3: 20%
Factor 4: 15%
Factor 5: 10%

What percentage of the total variance in the data is accounted for by these five factors?
message_2:
To find the percentage of the total variance accounted for by these five factors, you simply add the percentages of variance explained by each factor:

30% (Factor 1) + 25% (Factor 2) + 20% (Factor 3) + 15% (Factor 4) + 10% (Factor 5) = 100%

So, these five factors account for 100% of the total variance in the data.
